vision.title: Vision
vision.heading:
Unprecedented demands.
Nuclear-grade quality.
vision.content:
A Century of Innovation and Challenge
Engineers United to Tackle the Unprecedented

For over 100 years, Yoshida Inc., Ltd. has faced complex challenges head-on. In the high-stakes world of nuclear power, where failure is not an option, we’ve developed and refined technologies for shielding and isolating radioactive materials, including our signature glove boxes.

Today, our expertise extends far beyond the nuclear industry. We design and deliver fully custom-made solutions tailored to the unique needs of diverse fields such as medicine, energy, and space.

From nuclear power to space exploration, Yoshida remains committed to innovation, continuing to lead the way with our advanced shielding and isolation technologies.

message.title: MESSAGE
message.heading: Greetings from the Representative Director
message.content:
At Yoshida, we’re always looking for new challenges and ways to grow.
Since our founding in 1923, we’ve built over 100 years of experience and history. In 1961, we became the first company in Japan to design and manufacture gloveboxes, marking our entry into the nuclear industry.

Our strength lies in our in-house integrated production system, where design, fabrication/welding, and machining departments work closely together. This allows us to create products that fully meet our customers’ needs.

In recent years, we have been actively engaged in research and development, collaborating with universities, research institutions, and venture companies on a variety of projects. These include the development of next-generation gloveboxes with remote operation capabilities and the verification of separation methods for organic solvents used at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. We are also exploring new ways to apply our proprietary technologies, such as adapting the shielding and containment techniques developed during the Fukushima decommissioning work for use in fields like medicine and aerospace.

We strive to be the company our customers turn to when they face challenges, and we will continue to build a system that enables us to fully realize their requirements.

Thank you for your continued support.

timeline.content: Hisao Yoshida, the founder, established the business as a sole proprietorship at 817 Hon 8-chome, Mito City.
A factory was established in Minamimachi, Mito City, under the name Tsuruta Second Ironworks.
The factory relocated to 7985 Tanaka, Nakaminato City, and began operations under the name Yoshida Ironworks.
The company changed to a corporate structure and was established as Yoshida Ironworks Inc., with Ken Yoshida appointed as President.
Secured contract to supply gloveboxes to the Power Reactor and Nuclear Fuel Development Corporation.
New large-scale machinery factory established at 2363 Shiogasaki, Tokizumi Village.
New welding and fabrication plant was built.
The Shimodate Factory was newly established at 1400 Ogawa, Shimodate City.
The company reorganized as a corporation and established as Yoshida Inc.
New warehouse established in Koizumi-cho, Mito City.
Opened a new head office factory in Rokutanda-cho, Mito City.

project1.title: Remote-Controlled Robot Arm: Next-Generation Glove Box
project1.description: This project aims to reduce radiation exposure and contamination risks during operations. By combining shielding and isolation technologies developed through glove box manufacturing with robotic arms, we achieve both safety and work efficiency. We collaborate in a consortium with national universities and venture companies to tackle these challenges.

content.title: CONTENTS
content.subTitle: Project Details
content.description: Radiation-resistant robotic arms and fingertip end effectors are integrated into the glove boxes. Robots perform tasks in place of human hands, while operators control them remotely from a safe distance. Tactile feedback replicates the sense of grip, enabling precise handling even in delicate analytical work.
developmentItems: • Three-fingered end effector with radiation resistance and tactile feedback
• Controller specialized for analytical arm operations

project2.title: Water separation process from organic solvents
project2.description: Disposal of organic solvents is subject to various regulations. Yoshida is advancing demonstration tests using proven solvent concentration technology to safely and efficiently separate solvents from moisture. Collaboration with specialists drives ongoing efforts to solve customer challenges.

content.title: CONTENTS
content.subTitle: Project Details
content.description: The process under consideration involves adding a specialized solvent to water to selectively extract only the moisture, followed by safe treatment and reuse. This approach aims to reduce processing costs while minimizing environmental impact.

equipment.title: EQUIPMENT
equipment.subTitle: Factory Equipment
equipment.description:
Our headquarters factory sits on a 14,000 m² site with 4,500 m² of building space, and is divided into three main departments: fabrication, machining, and turning. Each area offers a spacious layout of approximately 15 by 90 meters.

The facility is equipped with a 30-ton twin overhead crane, along with 10-ton and 5-ton cranes, allowing for the safe handling and transport of long and heavy components with a lifting height of up to 12 meters.

We operate a range of advanced machinery, including 5-axis machining centers, gantry-type 5-face machining machines, horizontal boring mills, and vertical lathes (up to 2.5 meters in diameter). This enables us to provide end-to-end support for everything from large-scale machining to processing of welded structures.

Utilizing 5-axis machining centers, portal 5-face machining centers, horizontal boring mills, and vertical lathes (φ2.5m), we provide integrated support from large equipment fabrication to high-precision machining.

metadata.title: Quality Assurance | Yoshida Corporation | Professional Fabrication, Welding & Machining
metadata.description: Discover Yoshida Corporation's quality assurance initiatives. We achieve thorough quality management through a management system that incorporates nuclear standards into ISO9001-compliant quality assurance systems.

overview.title:
High-standard quality control built 
from nuclear industry experience.
overview.description: Drawing on years of experience in nuclear equipment manufacturing, we operate a quality management system based on ISO 9001, enhanced with nuclear industry standards. This system has been extended to new fields such as medical and aerospace, enabling consistent quality control and full traceability from design to inspection.

sections.title: Commitment to Quality  01
sections.subTitle: Inspection during the process
sections.description: We perform various inspections such as measuring dimensions, checking appearance, and testing for cracks or leaks. After important steps, we carry out intermediate checks to make sure only quality products move on.  Before shipping, we have final inspections and allow customers to observe, using several quality checkpoints along the way to prevent defective items from being sent out.

sections.title: Commitment to Quality  02
sections.subTitle: Inspection equipment tuning
sections.description:
All measuring equipment is calibrated, assigned a control number, and properly managed. Each calibration has an expiration date, and only equipment within its valid period is used for final inspections. Calibration is outsourced to accredited organizations, and calibration records linked to certificates with the JCSS mark are kept for each device.
Upon request, we can provide calibration certificates along with inspection records.

sections.title: Commitment to Quality  03
sections.subTitle: Material Traceability
sections.description:
We confirm materials by cross-checking stencils, mill certificates, and drawings.
Labeled materials ensure traceability of parts in each product.
This allows quick identification and tracking for prompt investigation and corrective action if needed.

sections.title: Commitment to Quality  04
sections.subTitle: Final Inspection with 3D Measurement System
sections.description:
For products with complex shapes or tight geometric tolerances, we perform final inspections using calibrated 3D measuring machines.
Automated measurement programs accurately check features like roundness and virtual points, with all results saved as data. We create optimal measurement plans based on shape, inspection points, and sample size to ensure high-quality products are shipped.

content.introduction:
We designed, manufactured, and installed lead-shielded glove boxes and analytical glove boxes for decommissioning work.
This glove box is characterized by closing the lead shield when handling high-dose samples and operating with manipulators.
Conversely, when handling low-dose samples, the lead shield can be opened, allowing glove operation.
As a new initiative, instead of lead glass for internal viewing, we installed multiple cameras to enable complete monitoring of the glove box interior.
(Patent obtained: Patent 6850464 'Shielding Glove Box')
The internal mechanism utilizes both manipulators and general-purpose robots to reduce work time.
Samples diluted in the lead-shielded glove box are transferred to the analytical glove box using a double-door system.

metadata.description: Join Yoshida Corporation and be part of our journey from nuclear to space. We seek passionate engineers ready to take on unprecedented challenges.

aboutUs.title2: A place where engineers continue their challenges
aboutUs.content:
At Yoshida Inc., we leverage the shielding and isolation technologies developed through the decommissioning of Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant and apply them to pharmaceutical and aerospace industries.
By partnering with universities, research institutes, and startups, we’re constantly exploring new frontiers across a variety of industries.
Every day brings fresh, unprecedented challenges—nothing here is easy.
But just like in an experiment, we keep generating new ideas, and as a close-knit team working across departments, we face these challenges together.

Through continuous technical growth, you’ll expand your knowledge and skills, gaining the power to shape a new future.

Always be a Pioneer.
At Yoshida, we welcome your pioneering spirit.

policy.title: Privacy Policy
policy.subtitle: Privacy Policy

sections.heading: Article 1: Management of Personal Information
sections.content: The Company maintains customer personal information accurately and up-to-date, and takes necessary measures—including maintaining security systems, establishing management structures, and thorough employee training—to prevent unauthorized access, loss, damage, falsification, or leakage of personal information. We implement appropriate security controls to strictly manage personal data.

sections.heading: Article 2: Purpose of Use
sections.content:
Personal information provided by customers will be used for the following purposes:
To collect customer feedback and opinions
To respond to inquiries and requests for materials
For market research and new service development
To send email newsletters and publications
To provide information about our products and services or those of affiliated companies
For recruitment-related information, selection, and surveys
To manage and inform about seminars, lectures, exhibitions, and events
For other matters incidental or related to our business

sections.heading: Article 3: Proper Management and Protection
sections.content: We strictly manage personal information and take appropriate preventive and corrective actions to protect against unauthorized access, loss, destruction, falsification, or leakage.

sections.heading: Article 4: Disclosure to Third Parties
sections.content:
The Company will not disclose or provide personal information to third parties except in the following cases:
With the prior consent of the individual
When required by law
When there is sufficient reason to believe disclosure is necessary to protect the Company’s rights, property, or services due to violations of service terms
When necessary to protect life, body, or property, and obtaining consent is difficult
When particularly necessary to improve public health or promote sound upbringing of children, and obtaining consent is difficult
When cooperating with national or local government agencies or their agents in performing legal duties, and obtaining consent would interfere with those duties
In the event of business succession such as mergers, company splits, or business transfers, including the provision of personal information

sections.heading: Article 5: Entrustment and Joint Use
sections.content: The Company may entrust all or part of the personal information obtained to contractors or share it jointly with related parties within the scope necessary to achieve the intended purpose. We carefully review the suitability of contractors, include confidentiality obligations in contracts, and properly supervise contractors. In cases of joint use, we will disclose in advance the items of personal information shared, the scope of users, the purpose of use, and the person responsible for managing the shared information.

sections.heading: Article 6: Inquiry and Correction Requests
sections.content: Requests for confirmation, correction, or deletion of personal information from individuals will be promptly addressed after verifying the requester’s identity.

sections.heading: Article 7: Disclaimer
sections.content: The Company is not responsible for any personal information voluntarily disclosed by individuals through use of our services or by other means, or for any identification of individuals through such information. We also disclaim responsibility for information or services provided by third-party websites accessed via links on our site.

sections.heading: Article 9: Compliance and Policy Review
sections.content: The Company complies with applicable Japanese laws and standards concerning personal information and regularly reviews and improves this policy as needed.

sections.heading: Article 10: Contact for Privacy Matters
sections.content:
For inquiries or requests regarding personal information protection, disclosure, correction, or deletion, please contact:
Email: soumu@ysd-k.co.jp

policy.intro: Yoshida Corporation (Referred to as “the Company” below) recognizes that personal information is an important asset of individuals. We are committed to properly obtaining and using personal information, complying with relevant laws and regulations, and preventing and correcting any leaks or misuse of personal data. To this end, we have established the following privacy policy and manage personal information with utmost care. Please note that this policy does not apply to personal information collected by other businesses or via external links.
